short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Converts glucose units from mmol/L to mg/dL and vice versa

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Effortlessly understand blood glucose readings across the web, no matter what units used.

Are you tired of juggling between mg/dL and mmol/L when reading about blood glucose online? Gluconverter is your trusted companion for seamless unit conversion, right where you need it.

This extension helps you view glucose values in your preferred units, making online health information more accessible. While we've rigorously tested it on numerous websites, please keep in mind:

Always verify important medical information
This tool complements but doesn't replace professional medical advice
Consult your healthcare provider for health-related decisions

We're committed to accuracy and user safety. If you notice any discrepancies or have suggestions, please get in touch at gluconverter@diajourneys.com  â€“ here to help!
By using this extension, you acknowledge these points. Happy glucose tracking!

Key Features:

- Instant Conversion: Instantly converts blood glucose values to your preferred units.
- Universal Compatibility: Works on any website, from medical websites to diabetes forums.*
- User-Friendly: Set your preferred units once, and convert a page with a single click.
- Quick Converter Tool: Instantly convert individual glucose values in real-time, perfect for on-the-fly calculations.
Privacy-Focused: All conversions happen locally in your browser. Your data stays with you.

Perfect For:

People managing diabetes
Health-conscious individuals tracking blood sugar
Healthcare professionals needing quick reference
Anyone interested in metabolic health



* This glucose unit converter extension is designed to assist users in converting glucose values on websites to their preferred units. While extensively tested, we cannot guarantee its accuracy on all websites. This tool is for informational purposes only and is not a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Always consult with a qualified healthcare provider before making any health-related decisions. Users are responsible for verifying the accuracy of converted values, especially for critical health decisions.
